item.title: Entire pavement missing outside our home, obstructing our driveway and melting on the roadside, 13th July
item.description:
Outside 31 Paddocks Lane, our home, the entire pavement has been lifted by National Grid due to a power cut that took place on 9 July 2025. We have received no communication as to when the destruction will be fixed and it is impeding access to our driveway which is causing us particular issues as I have a mobility problem. The rubble left behind is melting in the heat causing a bigger area of disruption and the exposed pipe works now appear to have brown liquid puddling around them. Please can we have an update on when this will be fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Paddocks Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree was cut down but roots never removed, previous reference number - 11451401, 12th July
item.description:
33 Linden Avenue - corner plot. Reference of job - 11451401 The tree was cut down and the root was due to be removed but no one ever returned. An arboricultual assessment report took place to prove the damage was caused by roots from the tree. The tree was removed around September last year after being originally reported in February 2024, the roots continue to damage my property and are getting ever closer to the house. My 2 year son has also been injured as a result of the slabs being damaged. We have made numerous calls for someone to return and finish the job and solve the problem but nothing has happened. This is now impacting our ability to have a family life in the garden and causes anxiety to our family as the roots become dangerously close to the house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Linden Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
